title: 104_hr4134
content: TITLE VI--AUTHORIZING STATES TO DISQUALIFY CERTAIN ALIENS NOT LAWFULLY PRESENT IN THE UNITED STATES FROM PUBLIC EDUCATION BENEFITS. Congressional policy regarding ineligibility of aliens not lawfully present in the United States for public education benefits. Congress declares that aliens who are not lawfully present in the United States are not entitled to public education benefits in the same manner as US citizens, nationals, and lawful resident aliens. States should not be obligated to provide public education benefits to aliens who are not lawfully present in the US. The text chunk expresses Federal policy regarding aliens lawfully present in the US, excluding public education benefits under State law, and addressing the exclusion or deportation of unlawfully present aliens. The text chunk discusses the authority of states. Sec. 602 allows each state to determine the eligibility of public education benefits for aliens not lawfully present in the US, requiring them to pay a fee if eligible. The State determines eligibility for public education benefits for aliens not lawfully present in the US, requiring a fee if eligible. Individuals must declare citizenship or lawful presence in the US under penalty of perjury. The State determines eligibility for public education benefits for aliens lawfully present in the US by verifying immigration status through documentation or other reasonable evidence. Screening procedures must be provided for all individuals seeking such benefits, and optional verification can be done through the SAVE system. The State must provide a fair hearing for aliens denied public education benefits to establish lawful presence. States are not required to deny benefits to aliens not lawfully present. Protected aliens enrolled between September 1, 1996, and July 1, 1997, cannot be denied public education benefits. Protected aliens, not lawfully present, enrolled in public schools between September 1, 1996, and July 1, 1997, are entitled to benefits under this section. Immigration status of aliens, including any benefits or proceedings, is not affected by this section. TITLE VI--AUTHORIZING STATES TO DISQUALIFY CERTAIN ALIENS NOT LAWFULLY PRESENT IN THE UNITED STATES FROM PUBLIC EDUCATION BENEFITS. Congressional policy and authority of States regarding ineligibility of aliens not lawfully present in the United States for public education benefits. Passed the House of Representatives on September 25, 1996. Attest: ROBIN H. CARLE, Clerk.
